A Sceptic's Guide to Ghosts: Non-believing your way through the paranormal world
The first-ever skeptical guide to the paranormal
Ghosts are everywhere—in our TV sets, in our smartphones, and even in our own homes. But the truth often gets lost among the paranormal hype. As a result, many people who claim to have seen or experienced paranormal phenomena are unaware that their experiences are the result of common misperceptions, misinterpretations, and triggers.
In A Skeptics's Guide to Ghosts, seasoned paranormal investigator Benjamin Radford offers a no-nonsense, science-based approach to the supernatural. Drawing on twenty-five years of research, including thousands of investigations and experiences, Radford explains the psychology of ghostly encounters and demystifies the many myths and legends surrounding them. He examines different types of phenomena, including unexplained footsteps, levitation, cold spots, and ghostly apparitions, and presents ways that believers and skeptics alike can approach these mysterious experiences.
Filled with real-world examples, A Skeptics's Guide to Ghosts is the perfect resource for anyone seeking to separate fact from fiction in the paranormal world.
About Benjamin Radford
Benjamin Radford is a world-renowned investigator of unexplained phenomena and a New York Times bestselling author. He has appeared on numerous TV shows, including The Tonight Show, Entertainment Tonight, and Beyond Bedlam. In 2008, he was awarded the "National Paranormal Society's Award of Merit" for his work in ufology and paranormal investigation.
